intro: Cleome foliosa, commonly known as the leafy cleome, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in summer. Cleome foliosa thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its rapid growth and ability to self-seed make it a hardy and easy-to-maintain plant.
